results.title: Conquering the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses new methods of exploiting the resources of the sea to be expected in the next century: fish farming and other means of food production, underwater mining and permanent residence for those employed, extraction of dissolved minerals, desalination for fresh water, and power generation.

results.title: Connie the cow: a curious butterfly
results.creator_credit: Cristina Brandner, Neptuno Films and Josep Viciana
results.brief_description: Join Connie the Cow, the very curious cow, in six colourful animated adventures. We all know that Connie loves to explore, make new friends and play. She is young and very mischievous. Every morning she wakes to explore the farm with her friends and brings about some exciting adventures. Music by Josep Roig.

results.title: Connemara and its ponies
results.brief_description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.
results.description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.

results.brief_description: Discusses the causes and mechanism of congestive failure and explains what the patient and doctor may do to give relief and prevent recurrence.

results.title: Confusion: diagnosis and management
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
One in a series about techniques for the management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This episode looks in some detail, at the various causes of acute confusion, outlining the basic principles of treatment.

results.title: Confusion
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
An elderly woman is found ill and confused by her neighbour. We follow the process of hospital admission through her eyes. The film stresses the importance of correct initial diagnosis and the importance of sympathetic attitudes from medical staff.

results.title: Confucianism and the Taiwan experience
results.creator_credit: Wu Li-Ching and Kwang Hwa Mass Communications
results.brief_description: Confucianism focuses on diligence, thrift, harmony and love of learning. This documentary looks at how the people of Taiwan have taken these values to heart in the economic rebuilding of their country. Modern Taiwan is drawing on the spirit of Confucianism for inspiration as the republic progresses towards the 21st Ccentury.
